content: ## How to manage execution data on Cloud Execution data includes node data, parameters, variables, execution context, and binary data references. It's text-based. Binary data is non-textual data that n8n can't represent as plain text. This is files and media such as images, documents, audio files, and videos. It's much larger than textual data. If a workflow consumes a large amounts of data and is past testing stage, it's a good option to stop saving the successful executions. There are two ways you can control how much execution data n8n stores in the database: In the admin dashboard: 1. From your workspace or editor, navigate to **Admin Panel**. 1. Select **Manage**. 1. In **Executions to Save** deselect the executions you don't want to log. In your workflow settings: 1. Select the **Options** ![Options menu](/_images/common-icons/three-dot-options-menu.png){.off-glb} menu. 1. Select **Settings**. n8n opens the **Workflow settings** modal. 1. Change **Save successful production executions** to **Do not save**.
